newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile's Endesa prepares Colombia bid.
newsitem.headline: Chile's Endesa prepares Colombia bid.

text.p: Chilean generator Empresa Nacional de Electricidad (Endesa) said it expects to strike a deal this week with a consortium to bid in the sale of two hydro-electric power stations in Colombia.

"At the moment (Endesa) general manager Jaime Bauza is in Colombia closing the deal with the partners," president Jose Yuraszeck told reporters at a regional energy confernce. "The agreement is likely to be signed tomorrow (Friday)."
Yuraszeck declined to give details of the other firms which will link up with Endesa to bid for the Chivor and Betania electricity plants.

Endesa, Chile's largest electricity generator, already has investments in Peru and Argentina and is also studying moving into the Brazilian and Mexican markets. --Rodrigo Martinez, Santiago newsroom, 562-699-5595x205
